The city has received 1 inch of rain in a day. The Meteorological Department has issued an alert of heavy rain for the next 3 days. It has been raining in the city for the last 9 days.

The rain in June has broken the record of 2 years. So far 8.9 inches of water has fallen, which is 2 inches more than last year. At the same time, the highest rainfall has occurred for the third time in 10 years. Heavy rain will continue on Sunday as well.

In such a situation, the record of the year 2021 is likely to break. This year 10.5 inches of rain was recorded. It has been raining in Bhopal since June 21. It rained for 9 consecutive days. Due to this, the rainfall figure has increased and the average rainfall amount of June has also been full.

The Meteorological Department has also issued an alert of heavy rain for the next 4 days i.e., June 30, July 1, 2 and 3. Heavy rain is expected on Sunday.

There is an orange alert for rain on June 30 and July 1. Heavy rain may also occur on July 2. Due to rain, day and night temperatures may drop.
summary:
Madhya Pradesh experienced strong monsoon activity on Saturday, with heavy rains in districts like Bhopal, Indore, and Ujjain. Lightning claimed three lives in Rewa, and torrential rains caused flooding and traffic jams in Indore, with 15 mm of rain in 40 minutes. Roads in areas like Khajrana Square and AB Road BRTS were waterlogged. Bhopal recorded 1 inch of rain on Saturday, with heavy rainfall continuing for the ninth consecutive day. 

The city has received 8.9 inches of rain this June, surpassing last year’s total by 2 inches, and is on track to break 2021's record of 10.5 inches. The Meteorological Department issued an orange alert for heavy rain from June 30 to July 3, forecasting further rainfall that could lower temperatures. Several areas, including Raisen Road and MP Nagar, remain affected by heavy showers, with residents bracing for continued rainfall in the coming days.

headline: Kalki 2898 AD box office collection Day 3: Prabhas-starrer earns Rs 415 crore worldwide
article:
Nag Ashwin’s Kalki 2898 AD, featuring a stellar cast including Prabhas, Deepika Padukone, Amitabh Bachchan and Kamal Haasan, hit theaters on June 27. In just three days, the film has grossed Rs 220 crore in India across all languages, according to sacnilk.com. Despite the T20 World Cup 2024 Final on Saturday, Kalki 2898 AD earned Rs 67.1 crore India net across languages, with the Telugu version contributing Rs 126.9 crore, followed by Hindi earning Rs 72.5 crore, and Tamil garnering Rs 12.8 crore. Globally, Kalki 2898 AD has amassed Rs 298.5 crore in just two days. Vyjayanthi Movies also took to its social media handle to announce that the film has grossed Rs 415 crore world-wide in three days since its release.  
On June 29, the film witnessed an overall 74.24% Telugu occupancy with 56.64% cine-goers coming for morning shows while 76.50% watched the afternoon shows. Evening and night shows were watched by 78.88% and 84.93% of the audience, respectively. 

Trade analyst and critic, Taran Adarsh took to his X (formerly Twitter) to share an update on Kalki 2898 AD box office collection. “TRIUMPHANT RUN CONTINUES… WILL HIT CENTURY  TODAY… MASSIVE SUNDAY ON THE CARDS… #Kalki2898AD packs a solid punch on Day 3 [Sat], despite #T20WorldCupFinal… National chains witness growth, mass circuits record strong occupancy… In short, biz zooms upwards across the board. Expectedly, the all-important #T20WorldCupFinal [#INDvSA] was an obstacle, impacting its biz from 6 pm onwards… Night shows got affected as well. Nonetheless, a MASSIVE SUNDAY is on the cards… #Kalki2898AD should cover the shortfall on Day 4 [Sun] and clock an IMPRESSIVE TOTAL in its 4-day extended weekend (sic),” he wrote.

He further pointed out that the film is likely to cross Rs 100 crore mark on day 4, Sunday. “As a matter of fact, Day 4 [Sun] is expected to be the best-performing day in this 4-day extended weekend… Should cruise past Rs 100 cr mark TODAY [Day 4; Sun], as per trends. [Week 1] Thu 22.50 cr, Fri 23.25 cr, Sat 26.25 cr. Total: Rs 72 cr Nett BOC. #India biz. #Boxoffice. NOTE: Data of HINDI version only,” read his tweet.

Opening with a bang, Kalki 2898 AD garnered Rs 95.3 crore (net India) on its first day, followed by Rs 57.6 crore on Friday. After an impressive debut, earning Rs 191.5 crore globally on its opening day, the Prabhas film experienced a notable drop on day two with the film’s earnings falling significantly by 43% from its initial Rs 95.3 crore in India with a total net collection of Rs 149.3 crore in India. Breakdown by language reveals the Telugu version leading with Rs 25.65 crore, while the Tamil version earned Rs 3.5 crore. The Hindi dub brought in Rs 22.5 crore, and the Kannada and Malayalam versions collected Rs 0.35 crore and Rs 2 crore, respectively.

 

The movie made history with a global opening of Rs 191 crore, positioning it as the third biggest opener in Indian cinema. It surpassed the opening day records of blockbusters like KGF 2 and Jawan, though RRR and Baahubali 2 still hold the top spots.

Kalki 2898 AD was released in Telugu, Tamil, Hindi, Kannada, and Malayalam. In its Tamil version, the film which opened to Rs 4.5 crore, earned Rs 3.5 crore on its second day. Meanwhile in Kannada, the film earned Rs 30 lakh on day 1 and Rs 35 lakh on day 2. In Malayalam, the film earned a total of Rs 4.4 crore in two days with Rs 2.2 crore on day 1 and Rs 2 crore on day 2, respectively. Kalki 2898 AD’s total two-day collection stands at Rs 149.3 crore nett in India.

Kalki 2898 AD, a dystopian sci-fi epic led by Prabhas, has not only achieved box office success but also received positive reviews. On IMDb, it boasts a rating of 8.4/10, surpassing Vikram and closely competing with Leo. Shubhra Gupta, film critic at The Indian Express, wrote in her review, “The thing is, a film of this order of magnitude, will be a sprawl. It will have a whole array of characters. That’s a given. It also has an entire phalanx of celebrity cameos which makes for several fan moments, and not much else. The challenge is to keep everything up and running, while keeping us suitably engaged. ‘Kalki’ manages to do this only post-interval, after getting us all bored and impatient in the first.” She rated the film two and a half stars.
summary: Nag Ashwin's Kalki 2898 AD, featuring Prabhas, Deepika Padukone, Amitabh Bachchan, and Kamal Haasan, has made a remarkable debut at the box office, grossing Rs 220 crore in India and Rs 298.5 crore globally in just three days. Despite the T20 World Cup 2024 Final, the film earned Rs 67.1 crore in India net, with the Telugu version contributing the highest. Trade analyst Taran Adarsh predicts that the film will cross the Rs 100 crore mark on its fourth day, Sunday. Kalki 2898 AD has received positive reviews and boasts a rating of 8.4/10 on IMDb.

headline: IGIA roof collapse: Victim's family to decide on legal action after cremation
article:
The son of the 45-year-old cab driver who died after a portion of a canopy at the Delhi airport collapsed amid heavy rains said the family will take a decision on filing a case in the matter after his father's cremation.

 The police handed over the body of the cab driver, Ramesh Kumar, to his family after postmortem at the Safdarjung Hospital on Saturday, a day after the incident, officials said.

 "At around 12.30 pm, we received the body of my father after postmortem and we will return to our house. We will go for cremation at around 3.30 pm near our house," Ramesh's 25-year-old son Ravinder said.

 He said after his father's cremation, all the family members will discuss and decide whether they would file a case against those responsible for his father's death.

 Ramesh was waiting for some passengers at the IGI T-1 Friday early morning when a portion of a canopy covering the departure area collapsed on parked cars amid three hours of heavy rain in the national capital. Six people were also injured in the incident, prompting authorities to suspend flight departures.

 On Friday, Ravinder had said  that he was sleeping when he got a call from the police station asking him to come to the Delhi airport's Terminal 1 immediately.

 Ravinder, who is also a cab driver by profession, was sleeping after finishing his night shift when he got to know about his father's death on Friday.

 Ramesh is survived by his wife Asha, two sons, Ravinder and Ashish (22), and two daughters, Rashi (21) and Bhawana (18) -- all of whom stay at a rented house in Vijay Vihar area of Rohini close to Sector 7. Asha works as a domestic help in Rohini.

 Upset over the compensation amount offered by the government, Ravinder had said that he had recently purchased the vehicle for Rs 5 lakh and had to make a down payment of Rs 1 lakh.

 Civil Aviation Minister K Rammohan Naidu, who visited the airport and took stock of the situation at T1, announced a compensation of Rs 20 lakh for the family.
summary:
Ramesh Kumar, a 45-year-old cab driver, tragically died when a portion of a canopy at Delhi’s IGI Airport Terminal 1 collapsed during heavy rain on Friday. Six others were injured, and flight departures were suspended. Ramesh, who was waiting for passengers, is survived by his wife Asha, two sons, and two daughters. The family lives in a rented house in Rohini, Delhi. 

Ramesh’s son Ravinder, also a cab driver, was informed of the incident while he was asleep after a night shift. The family received Ramesh's body after postmortem on Saturday and held cremation rites later that afternoon. They plan to discuss filing a case against those responsible for his death.

Civil Aviation Minister K. Rammohan Naidu announced Rs 20 lakh compensation for the family, though Ravinder expressed dissatisfaction, citing financial burdens, including a newly purchased vehicle.

headline: ‘BJP wastes 6 mths of tenure by reviewing Cong schemes’
article:
Jaipur: State Congress president Govind Singh Dotasra criticised the Bhajan Lal Sharma govt for wasting initial six months of its tenure by reviewing the welfare schemes implemented by the Congress govt.

Speaking to the media at the party office on Saturday, Dotasra asserted that BJP ministers are busy issuing statements regarding the closure, curtailment, or investigation of these schemes and the abolition of new districts established by the Congress govt.

“The BJP govt has not undertaken any initiatives in the public interest during the past six months. Their actions have been confined to internal conflicts, resignation announcements, and frequent visits to the Delhi darbar,” said Dotasra.

Accusing the BJP govt of taking away credit for the accomplishments of the previous Congress govt, he alleged that they are deceiving the people by portraying the previous govt’s work as their own through advertisements.

“The pension amount recently disbursed by the CM in Jhunjhunu was predicated on a law enacted by the previous Congress govt, which stipulated a minimum pension of Rs 1,000 with a 15% annual increment. Legally, the govt is obligated to increase the pension amount annually, which was a norm established by the previous Congress govt, but the CM is claiming credit as if it were an initiative of his govt,” said Dotasra.

He highlighted that the BJP govt has not issued any recruitment notifications for the youth but is endeavouring to take credit for the recruitments and exams conducted by the previous Congress govt. He emphasised that providing employment to youth is not a priority for the current government, as they have remained silent on the issue since assuming power.

We also published the following articles recently

Old pension scheme not an option for PET govt recruitsMore than 1,000 Pre-employment Scheme trainees demand to switch from the New Pension Scheme to the Old Pension Scheme. The rejection, based on the absence of provision in CCS (Pension) Rules, denied the request. In Nov 2021, govt staff in pre-2005 vacant posts had a one-time window to shift to the old scheme.111294982
We will not let criminals remain in Haryana when Congress govt is formed: HoodaUnder Congress leadership, Faridabad will see development and prosperity, with a focus on clean recruitments to eliminate corruption in job placements and ensure a brighter future for the region.111347558
Uddhav says double engine MahaYuti govt is Maha leakage govtPublic discontent rises as failed schemes and false promises plague the government, necessitating secretive elevator meetings to address growing impatience and demands for transparency and accountability
summary: State Congress president Govind Singh Dotasra criticized the Bhajan Lal Sharma government in Jaipur for its six-month delay in action, focusing instead on reviewing and undermining welfare schemes initiated by the previous Congress administration. Dotasra accused the BJP ministers of internal conflicts and neglecting public interests, highlighting their lack of new initiatives or recruitment notifications for youth employment. He alleged the BJP government of falsely claiming credit for the Congress government's achievements and criticized their handling of pension reforms and other welfare measures.

headline: DC Edit | Team India triumph in T20 WC, cricket the real
article: There was a flood of tears after Team India held off South Africa in a pulsating final of fluctuating fortunes. An 11-year wait for a significant ICC event cup victory had built up the emotions in a cricket-crazy country so much that grown sportsmen wept tears of joy on a sunny afternoon in Barbados in the Caribbean. As South Africa went down gallantly in pursuit of a gettable target, tears of sorrow were shed too. But Team India was the superior combination amongst the two unbeaten sides that reached the summit of a representative T20 World Cup of 20 teams in which freshers like the USA and Afghanistan performed way beyond expectations. There were match-turning moments in the final that swung the game the way of the favourites India after they had recovered from early losses on a good pitch as Virat Kohli expertly anchored the innings, relying more on temperament than ball-striking talent, even as a vastly underrated all-rounder in Axar Patel steadied the boat. A momentum-snapping injury time out as India wicket-keeper Rishabh Pant was tended to saw Heinrich Klaasen, who seemed determined to take South Africa storming to the target in style, get out off the bowling of Hardik Pandya. An extraordinarily composed catch on the boundary rope by Suryakumar Yadav off Pandya again sending David Miller back to the pavilion and some smart seam bowling by man of the series Jasprit Bumrah and Arshdeep Singh saw India prevail by seven runs in a thriller. Team India had been competitive in varying conditions, from the bowler-friendly drop-in pitches of New York and Miami, USA, to the more batting-conducive surfaces in the West Indies, its batters putting up defendable totals, no matter whether they were high or low and the fielders generally performing way beyond their known lack of alacrity. So good was the bowling, particularly by the spinners early on and then the pacers in the knockouts, led by the inestimably good fast bowler “Boom Boom Bumrah”, that India became the first to win a T20 World Cup unbeaten. Having ridden out stormy times as well as highs in their long careers, skipper Rohit Sharma and former captain Virat Kohli announced their retirement from T20 internationals, judging this victorious campaign to be the best time to call it quits. T20 is more of a team game than the two other formats that offer even more scope for individual performances. To shine in it, Team India had to reinvent themselves somewhat and a kindly skipper in Rohit who also showed the way with selflessly aggressive batting helped with his inclusive and calm approach and coach Rahul Dravid with his sheer persistence. The stars and the bits-and-pieces men shone to get Team India its fourth World Cup, two apiece in T20 and ODI formats.The event may have been tailored to Indian primetime TV viewership by a pliant ICC, beholden to Indian cricket for most of its riches. But Team India repaid the faith of a billion fans with a performance across trials and tribulation to induce national pride even if there should be no place for jingoism in sport. Former champions West Indies, Australia and England struggled to be consistent and were often caught short in T20 cricket that is tailormade for David versus Goliath upsets, at which Afghanistan sparkled with wins over New Zealand, Australia and Bangladesh before a semi-final against South Africa proved a bridge too far. The T20 game, better designed to give cricket a truly global reach, was a good advertisement for its attractions, even if glitches were galore in its organisation by a pedestrian ICC. The cricket behemoth India may have the most to celebrate but there was plenty for the others too, which means the game of cricket won as much as India’s always-optimistic fans.
summary: Team India clinched their long-awaited ICC T20 World Cup victory after an intense final against South Africa, which brought forth tears of joy and sorrow alike. Virat Kohli's resilient innings and Axar Patel's stabilizing performance were pivotal as India overcame early setbacks. Crucial moments like Rishabh Pant's injury timeout and Suryakumar Yadav's spectacular catch turned the game in India's favor. The team's adaptability across different pitch conditions, bolstered by outstanding bowling from Jasprit Bumrah and others, secured their unbeaten run throughout the tournament. Captains Rohit Sharma and Virat Kohli announced their retirement from T20 internationals following this triumph, underscoring the team's collective strength over individual prowess in T20 cricket. Despite controversies and challenges, including organizational issues by the ICC, the tournament showcased cricket's global appeal and India's dominance, while also highlighting surprises from teams like Afghanistan.

headline: Delhi govt announces Rs 10-lakh ex gratia for rain-related deaths on June 28
article:
The Delhi Government on Sunday announced a compensation of Rs 10 lakh to the next of kin of those who lost their lives following the unprecedented rain in the city on June 28.

Taking to social media, Delhi Cabinet Minister Atishi said: “Several deaths have been reported on 28th June, after extreme rainfall of 228 mm in 24 hours.”


“The families of all those who lost their lives will be given a compensation of ₹10 lakhs,” the minister added.




Atishi said directions have been given to the concerned department and officials to ensure that this compensation reaches the grieving families at the earliest.


In her letter to the ACS Revenue, Atishi directed to identify those who lost their lives with the help of area hospitals and the Delhi Police and immediately provide them with compensation on behalf of the GNCTD.

Meanwhile, the toll of rain-related deaths rose to ten, including the demise of a cab driver, at the airport, after a portion of the canopy of Terminal T1 collapsed.

While one person died of electrocution in the Rohini area, two others drowned in the Usmanpur area and another at Shalimar Bagh.

Bodies of three labourers, who were trapped in a pit of an under-construction building in the Vasant Vihar area on Friday, were recovered on Saturday by a joint team of the NDRF, SDRF, and DFS.

Meanwhile, in a separate incident, two boys aged nine years drowned near Siraspur underpass. They were rescued by the Delhi Fire Services (DFS) team and were brought to Babu Jagjivan Ram Hospital where they were declared dead.
summary: The Delhi government announced ₹10 lakh compensation for families of those who died due to heavy rainfall on June 28, 2024. Minister Atishi directed officials to quickly identify victims with the help of hospitals and police. The rain-related death toll rose to ten, including electrocution, drowning, and building collapse incidents.

headline: In Rajasthan, minister’s ‘DNA test to check if Hindu’ remark met with a protest
article:
Tribal leader and Banswara MP Rajkumar Roat on Saturday led a protest against Rajasthan Education Minister Madan Dilawar’s suggestion of a DNA test to verify if Roat was indeed a Hindu.

Holding their blood samples in their hands, Roat and the supporters of his Bharat Adivasi Party started marching towards Dilawar’s residence to mark a protest but were stopped by the police, after which they protested at the Amar jawan Jyoti.



“There is immense anger against Madan Dilawar’s comments. Until he resigns and apologises to the community, we will not let it go,” Roat said, adding that the minister has committed a grave mistake and the party will raise the issue in the state Assembly as well as before Prime Minister Narendra Modi in Parliament.

The controversy broke out on June 21 after Dilawar, while responding to a question on the tribal leader’s earlier remarks that he and his supporters were not Hindu, said: “Hain ke nahi hain, woh toh unke poorwajon se pooch lenge … aur Hindu nahi hain woh toh phir unke DNA ki jaanch kara lenge, unke baap ki aulad hain ke nahi woh (We will ask his ancestors whether he is a Hindu or not … and if (he says) he is not a Hindu, then we’ll get his DNA tested whether he is his father’s son or not).”

At Saturday’s protest, where he was joined by party MLA from Dungarpur Umesh Meena as well as Congress MLAs Ramkesh Meena (Gangapur) and Ghanshyam (Todabhim), Roat reiterated he does not fall under the Hindu varna system.

“Our country’s Constitution gives everyone the freedom to follow any religion or not…We do not oppose any religion but we indeed say that we do not come under any religion. Why should anyone have a problem? The BJP leaders should end the politics of religion and stop misleading the tribals,” he said. He added that the community is sending their hair, nails, etc. to Dilawar by post so that he can get their DNA tested.

Reacting to the protest, Dilawar repeated his earlier stance. “The tribals are a part of our community. They were Hindus, are Hindus, and will remain Hindus,” he said.

Other state BJP leaders, however, avoided commenting on the row, which comes as the bypolls for five Assembly seats are set to be held soon.

The BAP was formed out of the Bharatiya Tribal Party in September 2023. Like BTP, it advocates the creation of a ‘Bhil Pradesh’.

The community has consolidated under Roat and the BAP in some pockets. Against BTP’s two MLAs in the previous Assembly, the BAP now has three MLAs and one MP, with Roat defeating Congress rebel and BJP candidate Mahendra Jeet Singh Malviya in the Banswara Lok Sabha seat.

With Roat vacating his Chorasi Assembly seat to sit in Parliament, BAP’s figure may only go up.
summary: Tribal leader Rajkumar Roat and his supporters from the Bharat Adivasi Party protested against Rajasthan Education Minister Madan Dilawar's suggestion of a DNA test to verify Roat's Hindu identity. The protesters marched towards Dilawar's residence but were halted by the police. Roat demanded an apology from the minister and vowed to raise the issue in the state Assembly and before Prime Minister Narendra Modi. The controversy arose after Dilawar's remarks on June 21, stating that Roat's ancestry would confirm his Hindu status, and if not, a DNA test would be conducted. Roat reiterated that he does not identify with the Hindu varna system and called for an end to the politics of religion. Dilawar maintained his stance that the tribal community is part of Hinduism. The Bharatiya Tribal Party, out of which the Bharat Adivasi Party was formed in 2023, advocates for the creation of a 'Bhil Pradesh'. With three MLAs and one MP, the BAP has gained support in tribal pockets.
